revision.text:
=General:=
==Where can I play the latest version?== https://www.pokeclicker.com/
or download the Windows client:
https://github.com/RedSparr0w/Pokeclicker-desktop/releases/latest
==Is the Dynamic Background available without the game?== https://background.pokeclicker.com/
==What is the official Discord Server invite link?== https://discord.gg/a6DFe4p
==My game isn't running at full speed when the window isn't active.== This is a setting on browsers that slows down inactive windows, You can change the browser flags, but this is '''not''' recommended, Otherwise you can download the Windows client from here: https://github.com/RedSparr0w/Pokeclicker-desktop/releases/latest
==How do I obtain [[Dungeon Tokens]]?== Read the in game [[Quests#Tutorial|Tutorial]]. Set the "Caught" selector in the top left to a Pokéball type to capture Pokémon you have already caught.
=Saves:=
==Can I import my save from the previous version?== You can only import the shinies you obtained in the previous (IshaDjicks) version. They will only appear in your Pokemon list once re-captured (this will not count as capturing a new shiny Pokemon)
==Will my progress be carried over on release?== Your save file will likely be compatible with the final release.
=Rare/Shiny Pokémon:=
==What are the [[Roaming Pokémon#Odds|odds of finding a Roaming Pokémon]]?== The chance to encounter a roaming Pokémon is 1/8192 for the first route of a region, and increases linearly up to 1/4096 for the last route of a region. "First" and "Last" refer to the [[Route Statistics|Route Order]], not the route number.
==What are the [[Shiny Chance#Odds|odds of finding a Shiny Pokémon]]?== *On a Route - 1/8192 *In a [[Dungeons|Dungeon]] - 1/4096 *In the [[Safari Zone]] - 1/2048 *Using an [[Evolution Items|Evolution Item]] - 1/2048 *From a [[Shops|Shop]] - 1/2048 *From [[Pokémon Day Care|hatching]] an [[Egg]] - 1/1024 *[[Wandering Pokémon]] on the Farm - 1/1024
==Do Shiny Pokémon give any bonus to gameplay?== Yes, they give an extra 50% bonus to Click Attack compared to the non shiny variant.
==If I breed a Shiny Pokémon will it stay shiny?== Yes, once a Pokémon is shiny, it will always remain shiny.
==If I evolve a Shiny Pokémon will the evolution always be shiny?== There is also a 1/2048 chance the evolution will be shiny. If it is not, you will need to obtain the evolutions shiny via a different method.
=Items:=
==What are the [[Small Restore|Small]]/[[Medium Restore|Medium]]/[[Large Restore|Large]] used for?== They can be used in the [[Underground]] to restore some stamina.
==What are [[Berries]] used for?== Berries are currently used on the [[Farm]] to grow more berries and earn [[Farm Points]]. They also have special Auras, that can provide Gameplay bonuses, can attract [[Wandering Pokémon]], and can be traded for various items. '''Note:'''They will eventually have more uses
==What are [[Protein|Proteins]] used for?== They increase the "base attack" of your Pokémon, which will gain you more damage each time you breed them.
==How many [[Oak Items|Oak Item]] slots are available?== There is a maximum of 3 active slots.
=Gameplay:=
==How many [[Regions]] are playable?== Currently, [[Kanto]] through [[Alola]] are able to be played.
==How do I get to the next [[Regions|Region]]?== With the Recommended Challenges active, you must obtain all Pokémon available in the current region and then take the Blimp located at the region's starting town. (Note: See [[Challenge Mode]] for more information on Recommended Challenges)
'''Note:'''Once you go to the next region, you will not be able to go back to prior regions until you reach the [[Dock]] of the region you have entered.
==How do I increase my [[Pokémon Statistics#Click Attack|Click Attack]]?== Each new Pokémon increases your click attack. New Shiny Pokémon also increase your click attack by 50% of the rate that a normal new Pokémon would.
==How do I unlock the [[Gyms#Gym Auto-Rebattle|Auto Battle option for Gyms]]?== You must defeat a Gym Leader manually 100 times to unlock this feature for that Gym.
==How do I make the [[Dungeons#Dungeon_Size_Reduction|Dungeons smaller]]?== As you clear the dungeon more times, it will become smaller. (to a minimum of 5x5)
==How do I unlock [[Dungeons#Flash Ability|Flash in dungeons]]?== You must clear a dungeon 200 times to unlock this feature for that Dungeon.
==Can I progress more than 1 [[Quests|Quest]] at a time?== Yes, you can unlock up to 4 quest slots. *Quest Level 5: 2 slots. *Quest Level 10: 3 slots. *Quest Level 15: 4 slots.
==Where is X location in [[Kanto]]?== *[[Underground]]: Route 11. *[[Pokémon Day Care|Daycare]]: Route 5, or click List on the Hatchery. *[[Farm]]: Route 14.
==How do I unlock X location in [[Kanto]]?== *Underground: Buy the [[Explorer Kit]] from [[Shops#Kanto: Locations & Items|Cinnabar Island]]. *Daycare: Will be unlocked after reaching [[Kanto#Routes|Route 5]]. *Farm: Will be unlocked after reaching[[Kanto#Routes|Route 14]] and obtaining [[Berries]].
==Why should I be [[Pokémon Day Care|Breeding Pokémon]]?== [[Baby Pokémon|Some Pokémon]] can only be obtained by breeding. When a Pokémon is hatched, its attack will increase by 25% of the base amount. Breeding also has higher odds of obtaining Shiny Pokémon (1/1024).
==How do I obtain x Pokémon?== Make sure that you have completed every '''[[Regions|Route]]'''. Make sure that you have completed every '''[[Dungeons|Dungeon]]'''. Some Pokémon can only be obtained from '''[[Eggs]]'''. Some Pokémon can only be obtained by using an [[Evolution Items|'''Evolution Stone''']]. Some Pokémon can only be obtained from the '''[[Safari Zone]]'''. '''Fossil Pokémon''' can only be obtained by breeding [[Fossils]] that are obtained from the '''[[Underground]]''' '''(Roamers)''' Some Pokémon will only '''randomly''' appear on '''routes''' as [[Roaming Pokemon]]. '''(Baby Pokémon)''' [[Baby Pokemon]] can only be obtained by breeding their immediate evolution (the next stage). Some Pokémon can only evolve at certain times of day. Some Pokémon can only evolve in specific locations. Some Pokémon can only appear/evolve in specific [[Weather]].
=Development:=
==When will the development version be fully released?== There are currently no plans for a "final release". Maybe once all regions are added that will be version 1.0.0
==When will more regions be added?== This is a priority, but there in no set timeline. It will be ready when it is ready.
==Who are the awesome people developing this game?== The original game was developed by IshaDjicks, who has since decided to stop working on this project. Since then lots of people have helped by [[Code Contributors|Contributing Code]] via GitHub.
==How can I help with development?== The GitHub repo is located here: https://github.com/pokeclicker/pokeclicker.
Any new issues, suggestions or code contributions are always welcomed. You may even earn certain [[Discord Roles]] based on your contributions.
revision.comment: Update

==What are the [[Roaming Pokémon#Odds|odds]] of finding a [[Roaming Pokémon]]?== The chance to encounter a roaming Pokémon is 1/8192 for the first route of a region, and increases linearly up to 1/4096 for the last of a region.
"first and "last" here just being the route difficulty/HP, not necessarily the order you reach the route
==What are the [[Shiny Chance#Odds|odds]] of finding a [[Shinies|Shiny Pokémon]]?== *On a Route 1/8192 *In a dungeon 1/4096 *In the Safari Zone 1/2048 *Using an Evolution Item 1/2048 *From a Shop *From hatching an egg 1/1024 *Wandering on the Farm 1/1024

==If I breed a shiny Pokémon will it stay shiny?== Yes, once a Pokémon is shiny, it will always remain shiny.

=Items:=
==What is the small/medium/large restore used for?== They can be used in the [[Underground]] to restore some stamina.
==What are berries used for?== These [[Berries|items]] are currently only used for the Farm to grow more berries and earn [[Farm Points|money]].
'''Note:'''They will eventually have more uses ==Why is the '''Rare Candy''' so expensive?== They don't currently have a use, once a use is implemented the price will be adjusted. ==How many Oak Item slots are available?== There is a maximum of 3 active slots.
=Gameplay:=
==How many [[Regions]] are playable?== Currently, [[Kanto]] through to [[Alola]] are able to be played.
==How do I get to the next region?== You must obtain all Pokémon available in the current region.
'''Note:'''Once you get to the next region you will not be able to go back to previous regions until you reach the dock again.
==How do I increase my Click Attack?== New Pokémon you capture increase your click attack, shinies also increase your click attack at 50% efficiency
==Can I progress towards more than 1 [[Quests|Quest]] at a time?== Yes, you can unlock up to 4 quest slots. *Quest Level 5: 2 slots. *Quest Level 10: 3 slots. *Quest Level 15: 4 slots.
==Where is x location?== *[[Underground]]: Route 11. *[[Pokémon Day Care|Daycare]]: Route 5, or click List on the Hatchery. *[[Farm]]: Route 14.

==Why should I be breeding Pokémon?== Some Pokémon can only be obtained by breeding.
When a Pokémon is hatched, It's attack will increase by 25% of the base amount.
Breeding has higher odds of obtaining a shiny Pokémon (1/1024).
==How do I obtain x Pokémon?== Check you have completed every '''[[Regions|route]]'''.
Check each '''[[Dungeons|dungeon]]''' has been completed.
Some Pokémon only come from '''[[Eggs]]'''.
Some can only be obtained by using an [[Evolution Items|'''Evolution Stone''']].
Some can only be found in the '''[[Safari Zone]]''' (7 exclusives).
'''Fossil Pokémon''' can only be obtained with the correlating '''[[Fossils|Fossil]]''' from the '''[[Underground]]'''
[[Roaming Pokemon|'''(Roamers)''']]Some legendaries will appear '''randomly''' on '''routes'''.
[[Baby Pokemon|'''(Babies)''']] Breed their evolution.
Some can only evolve at certain times of day.
Some can only evolve in specific locations.
Some can only appear/evolve in specific [[weather]].
=Development:=
==When will the development version be fully released?== There are currently no plans for a "final release".
Maybe once all the regions are added that will be version 1.0.0
==When will more regions be added?==
This is a current priority, but there in no set timeline, it will be ready when it is ready. ==Who are the awesome guys/girls developing this game?== The original game was developed by @IshaD#1866, who has since decided to stop work on this project Since then lots of people have helped by contributing code via GitHub.
==How can I help with development?== The GitHub repo is located here:
https://github.com/pokeclicker/pokeclicker.
Any new issues, suggestions or code contributions are always welcomed.
You may even earn the @Poké Crew,@Code Contributor, or @Developer roles in discord.

=Development version FAQ=
==Where can I play the development version?== https://www.pokeclicker.com/
==Saves:==
===Can I import my save from the previous version? (0.9.3)=== You can only import the shinies you obtained in the previous version. They will only appear in your Pokemon list once re-captured (this will not count as capturing a new shiny Pokemon)
===Will my progress be carried over on release?=== Yes!
==Rare/Shiny Pokémon:==
===What are the [[Roaming Pokémon#Odds|odds]] of finding a [[Roaming Pokémon]]?=== The chance to encounter a roaming Pokémon is 1/8192 for the Lowest HP route of a region, and increases linearly up to 1/4096 for the Highest HP route of a region.
===What are the [[Shiny Chance#Odds|odds]] of finding a [[Shinies|Shiny Pokémon]]?=== *In the wild 1/8192 *In a dungeon 1/4096 *Using an evolution stone 1/2048 *From hatching an egg 1/1024
===Do shiny Pokémon give any bonus to gameplay?=== Yes, they boost your click attack by 50% of their standard version (e.g. 10 normal click attack -> 15 Shiny click attack)
===Does the shiny form of a standard Pokémon I already have (but is not yet shiny) count as a "New Pokémon" in the Pokéball selection?=== If you have not obtained the shiny variant yet, they will count as a new Pokémon.
===If I breed a shiny Pokémon will it stay shiny?=== Yes! Once an obtained Pokémon is shiny, it will always remain shiny.
===If I evolve a shiny Pokémon will the evolution be shiny?=== Maybe, there is a 1/2048 [[Shiny Chance|chance]] a Pokémon will evolve into a Shiny. You will probably need to obtain the shiny evolution via a different method (e.g. breeding, stone evolutions, Dungeons, etc.).
==Items:==
===What is the small/medium/large restore used for?=== They can be used in the [[Underground]] to restore stamina.
===What are berries used for?=== [[Berries]] have a wide variety of uses due to their special Auras, the [[Wandering Pokémon]] they can recruit, and the ability to be traded for rare items such as exclusive [[Pokéballs]], [[Protein|Proteins]], and [[Masterball|Masterballs]] with [[Berry Master|Berry Masters]] in various regions.
===Why is the Rare Candy so expensive?=== They don't currently have a use, once a use is implemented the price will be adjusted.
==Gameplay:==
===How many [[Regions]] are playable?=== Currently, Kanto, Johto, Hoenn, Sinnoh, Unova, and Kalos are able to be played.
===How do I get to the next region?=== You must obtain all Pokémon available in the current region. Note: Once you get to the next region you will not be able to go back to previous regions until you reach the dock again.
===Where did the upgrades go?=== They are no longer a part of the game, But [[Oak Items]] have been reworked to provide upgrades.
===Can I progress towards more than 1 [[Quests|Quest]] at a time?=== Yes, you can unlock up to 4 quest slots. *Quest Level 1: 1 slot. *Quest Level 10: 2 slots. *Quest Level 15: 3 slots. *Quest Level 20: 4 slots.
===Where is x location in [[Kanto]]?=== *[[Underground]]: Route 11. *[[Pokémon Day Care]]: Route 5, or click List on the Hatchery modal. *[[Farm]]: Route 14.
===How do I unlock x location?=== *Underground: Buy the [[Explorer Kit]] from [[Shops#Kanto: Locations & Items|Cinnabar Island]]. *Daycare: Unlock [[Kanto#Routes|Route 5]]. *Farm: Unlock [[Kanto#Routes|Route 14]] and obtain [[Berries]].
===Why should I be breeding Pokémon?=== When a Pokémon is hatched its attack will increase by 25% of its '''base''' amount. While breeding is not initially necesary, by later regions it is imperative for progression. Additionally, some Pokémon can only be obtained by breeding. Finally, Breeding has higher odds of obtaining a shiny Pokémon (1/1024).
===How do I obtain x Pokémon?=== Check you have completed every [[Regions|route]]. Check each [[Dungeons|dungeon]] has been completed. Some Pokémon only come from [[Eggs]]. Some can only be obtained by using an [[Evolution Items|Evolution Item]]. Some can only be found in the [[Safari Zone]]. Aerodactyl can only be obtained with an Old Amber from the [[Underground]] or from the Old Amber Quest. Some can only be purchased from [[Shops]]. Some legendaries will only appear randomly on routes as [[Roaming Pokémon]]. [[Baby Pokémon]] are obtained by breeding their evolution.
==Development:==
===When will the development version be fully released?=== There probably won't be a "final release".
===Will more regions be added?=== Yes!
===Who are the awesome people developing this game?=== The original game was developed by IshaD, Since then lots of people have helped by contributing code via GitHub.
===How can I help with development?=== The GitHub repo is located [https://github.com/pokeclicker/pokeclicker here]. Any new issues, suggestions or code contributions are always welcomed. You may even earn the Poké Crew, Code Contributor, or Developer roles on the official discord.

===Do shiny Pokémon give any bonus to gameplay?=== Yes, they boost your click attack by 50% of their standard version (e.g. 10 normal click attack -> 15 Shiny click attack)
===Does the shiny form of a standard Pokémon I already have (but is not yet shiny) count as a "New Pokémon" in the Pokéball selection?=== If you have not obtained the shiny variant yet, they will count as a new Pokémon.
===If I breed a shiny Pokémon will it stay shiny?=== Yes! Once an obtained Pokémon is shiny, it will always remain shiny.
===If I evolve a shiny Pokémon will the evolution be shiny?=== Maybe, there is a 1/2048 [[Shiny Chance|chance]] a Pokémon will evolve into a Shiny. You will probably need to obtain the shiny evolution via a different method (e.g. breeding, stone evolutions, Dungeons, etc.).
==Items:==
===What is the small/medium/large restore used for?=== They can be used in the [[Underground]] to restore stamina.
===What are berries used for?=== [[Berries]] have a wide variety of uses due to their special Auras, the [[Wandering Pokémon]] they can recruit, and the ability to be traded for rare items such as exclusive [[Pokéballs]], [[Protein|Proteins]], and [[Masterball|Masterballs]] with [[Berry Master|Berry Masters]] in various regions.
===Why is the Rare Candy so expensive?=== They don't currently have a use, once a use is implemented the price will be adjusted.
==Gameplay:==
===How many [[Regions]] are playable?=== Currently, Kanto, Johto, Hoenn, Sinnoh, Unova, and Kalos are able to be played.
===How do I get to the next region?=== You must obtain all Pokémon available in the current region. Note: Once you get to the next region you will not be able to go back to previous regions until you reach the dock again.
===Where did the upgrades go?=== They are no longer a part of the game, But oak items have been reworked to provide upgrades.
===Can I progress towards more than 1 quest at a time?=== Yes, you can unlock up to 4 quest slots. Quest Level 10: 2 slots. Quest Level 15: 3 slots. Quest Level 20: 4 slots.
===Where is x location?=== Underground: Route 11. Daycare: Route 5, or click List on the hatchery. Farm: Route 14.
===How do I unlock x location?=== *Underground: Buy the [[Explorer Kit]] from [[Shops#Kanto|Cinnabar Island]]. *Daycare: Unlock [[Kanto#Routes|Route 5]]. *Farm: Unlock [[Kanto#Routes|Route 14]] and obtain [[Berries]].
===Why should I be breeding Pokémon?=== When a Pokémon is hatched its attack will increase by 25% of its '''base''' amount. While breeding is not initially necesary, by later regions it is imperative for progression. Additionally, some Pokémon can only be obtained by breeding. Finally, Breeding has higher odds of obtaining a shiny Pokémon (1/1024).
===How do I obtain x Pokémon?=== Check you have completed every [[Regions|route]]. Check each [[Dungeons|dungeon]] has been completed. Some Pokémon only come from [[Eggs]]. Some can only be obtained by using an [[Evolution Items|Evolution Item]]. Some can only be found in the [[Safari Zone]]. Aerodactyl can only be obtained with an Old Amber from the [[Underground]] or from the Old Amber Quest. Some can only be purchased from a [[Shops|Shop]]. Some legendaries will only appear randomly on routes as [[Roaming Pokémon]]. [[Baby Pokémon]] are obtained by breeding their evolution.
==Development:==
===When will the development version be fully released?=== There probably won't be a "final release".
===Will more regions be added?=== Yes!
===Who are the awesome people developing this game?=== The original game was developed by IshaD, Since then lots of people have helped by contributing code via GitHub.
===How can I help with development?=== The GitHub repo is located here: https://github.com/pokeclicker/pokeclicker Any new issues, suggestions or code contributions are always welcomed. You may even earn the Poké Crew, Code Contributor or Developer roles on the official discord.
revision.comment: /* How many regions are playable? */

===Where is x location?=== Underground: Route 11. Daycare: Route 5, or click List on the hatchery. Farm: Route 14.
===How do I unlock x location?=== *Underground: Buy the [[Explorer Kit]] from [[Shops#Kanto|Cinnabar Island]]. *Daycare: Unlock [[Kanto#Routes|Route 5]]. *Farm: Unlock [[Kanto#Routes|Route 14]] and obtain [[Berries]].
===Why should I be breeding Pokémon?=== When a Pokémon is hatched its attack will increase by 25% of its '''base''' amount. While breeding is not initially necesary, by later regions it is imperative for progression. Additionally, some Pokémon can only be obtained by breeding. Finally, Breeding has higher odds of obtaining a shiny Pokémon (1/1024).
===How do I obtain x Pokémon?=== Check you have completed every [[Regions|route]]. Check each [[Dungeons|dungeon]] has been completed. Some Pokémon only come from [[Eggs]]. Some can only be obtained by using an [[Evolution Items|Evolution Item]]. Some can only be found in the [[Safari Zone]]. Aerodactyl can only be obtained with an Old Amber from the [[Underground]] or from the Old Amber Quest. Some can only be purchased from a [[Shops|Shop]]. Some legendaries will only appear randomly on routes as [[Roaming Pokémon]]. [[Baby Pokémon]] are obtained by breeding their evolution.
==Development:==
===When will the development version be fully released?=== There probably won't be a "final release".
===Will more regions be added?=== Yes!
===Who are the awesome people developing this game?=== The original game was developed by IshaD, Since then lots of people have helped by contributing code via GitHub.
===How can I help with development?=== The GitHub repo is located here: https://github.com/pokeclicker/pokeclicker Any new issues, suggestions or code contributions are always welcomed. You may even earn the Poké Crew, Code Contributor or Developer roles on the official discord.
revision.comment: /* If I evolve a shiny Pokémon will the evolution be shiny? */

revision.text:
=Development version FAQ=
==Where can I play the development version?== https://www.pokeclicker.com/
==Saves:==
===Can I import my save from the previous version? (0.9.3)=== You can only import the shinies you obtained in the previous version. They will only appear in your Pokemon list once re-captured (this will not count as capturing a new shiny Pokemon)
===Will my progress be carried over on release?=== Yes!
==Rare/Shiny Pokémon:==
===What are the odds of finding a roaming Pokémon?=== The chance to encounter a roaming Pokémon is 1/8192 for the lowest hp route of a region and increases linearly up to 1/4096 for the highest hp route of a region.
===What are the odds of finding a shiny Pokémon?=== *In the wild 1/8192 *In a dungeon 1/4096 *Using an evolution stone 1/2048 *From hatching an egg 1/1024
===Do shiny Pokémon give any bonus to gameplay?=== Yes, they boost your click attack by 50% of their standard version (e.g. 10 normal click attack -> 15 Shiny click attack)
===Does the shiny form of a standard Pokémon I already have (but is not yet shiny) count as a "New Pokémon" in the Pokéball selection?=== If you have not obtained the shiny variant yet, they will count as a new Pokémon.
===If I breed a shiny Pokémon will it stay shiny?=== Yes! Once an obtained Pokémon is shiny, it will always remain shiny.
===If I evolve a shiny Pokémon will the evolution be shiny?=== No. You will need to obtain the shiny evolution via a different method (e.g. breeding, stone evolutions, Dungeons, etc.).
==Items:==
===What is the small/medium/large restore used for?=== They can be used in the underground to restore stamina.
===What are berries used for?=== [[Berries]] have a wide variety of uses due to the special auras that some have and the Wandering Pokémon they can recruit. Berries can also be traded for rare items such as exclusive Pokéballs, Proteins, and Masterballs with Berry Masters.
===Why is the Rare Candy so expensive?=== They don't currently have a use, once a use is implemented the price will be adjusted.
==Gameplay:==
===How many regions are playable?=== Currently, Kanto, Johto, Hoenn, Sinnoh, Unova, and Kalos are able to be played.
===How do I get to the next region?=== You must obtain all Pokémon available in the current region. Note: Once you get to the next region you will not be able to go back to previous regions until you reach the dock again.
===Where did the upgrades go?=== They are no longer a part of the game, But oak items have been reworked to provide upgrades.
===Can I progress towards more than 1 quest at a time?=== Yes, you can unlock up to 4 quest slots. Quest Level 10: 2 slots. Quest Level 15: 3 slots. Quest Level 20: 4 slots.
===Where is x location?=== Underground: Route 11. Daycare: Route 5, or click List on the hatchery. Farm: Route 14.
===How do I unlock x location?=== *Underground: Buy the [[Explorer Kit]] from [[Shops#Kanto|Cinnabar Island]]. *Daycare: Unlock [[Kanto#Routes|Route 5]]. *Farm: Unlock [[Kanto#Routes|Route 14]] and obtain [[Berries]].
===Why should I be breeding Pokémon?=== When a Pokémon is hatched its attack will increase by 25% of its '''base''' amount. While breeding is not initially necesary, by later regions it is imperative for progression. Additionally, some Pokémon can only be obtained by breeding. Finally, Breeding has higher odds of obtaining a shiny Pokémon (1/1024).
===How do I obtain x Pokémon?=== Check you have completed every [[Regions|route]]. Check each [[Dungeons|dungeon]] has been completed. Some Pokémon only come from [[Eggs]]. Some can only be obtained by using an [[Evolution Items|Evolution Item]]. Some can only be found in the [[Safari Zone]]. Aerodactyl can only be obtained with an Old Amber from the [[Underground]] or from the Old Amber Quest. Some can only be purchased from a [[Shops|Shop]]. Some legendaries will only appear randomly on routes as [[Roaming Pokémon]]. [[Baby Pokémon]] are obtained by breeding their evolution.
==Development:==
===When will the development version be fully released?=== There probably won't be a "final release".
===Will more regions be added?=== Yes!
===Who are the awesome people developing this game?=== The original game was developed by IshaD, Since then lots of people have helped by contributing code via GitHub.
===How can I help with development?=== The GitHub repo is located here: https://github.com/pokeclicker/pokeclicker Any new issues, suggestions or code contributions are always welcomed. You may even earn the Poké Crew, Code Contributor or Developer roles on the official discord.

===Can I progress towards more than 1 quest at a time?=== Yes, you can unlock up to 4 quest slots. Quest Level 10: 2 slots. Quest Level 15: 3 slots. Quest Level 20: 4 slots.
===Where is x location?=== Underground: Route 11. Daycare: Route 5, or click List on the hatchery. Farm: Route 14.
===How do I unlock x location?=== Underground: Buy the Explorer Kit from Cinnabar island. Daycare: Receive 8 Gym badges and get a Pokémon to level 100. Farm: Will be unlocked after reaching route 14 and obtaining Berries.
===Why should I be breeding Pokémon?=== Some Pokémon can only be obtained by breeding. When a Pokémon is hatched, it attacks will increase by 25% of the base amount. Breeding has higher odds of obtaining a shiny Pokémon (1/1024).
===How do I obtain x Pokémon?=== Check you have completed every route. Check each dungeon has been completed. Some Pokémon only come from eggs. Some can only be obtained by using an Evolution Stone. Some can only be found in the Safari Zone (7 exclusives). Aerodactyl can only be obtained with an Old Amber from the Underground. Some can only be purchased from a Shop. Some legendaries will randomly appear on routes. (Babies) Breed their evolution. (Happiness) Reach level 100 after breeding.
==Development:==
===When will the development version be fully released?=== There is currently no set date for release.
===Will more regions be added?=== Probably, but other work has priority currently.
===Who are the awesome guys/girls developing this game?=== The original game was developed by @IshaD, Since then lots of people have helped by contributing code via GitHub.
===How can I help with development?=== The GitHub repo is located here: https://github.com/pokeclicker/pokeclicker Any new issues, suggestions or code contributions are always welcomed. You may even earn the Poké Crew, Code Contributor or Developer roles on the official discord.
